Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, I had my first of 6 x FEC-T last Friday. Main side effects are nausea, diarrhoea and tiredness. I've switched from domperidone to cyclizine now which seems to have sorted out the nausea; either that or it's just worn off by itself! Having to take Imodium for the other problem though Like you Ann, I found the cold cap the worst part of the chemo experience. I shivered my way through it with gritted teeth but I had a throbbing headache (despite taking paracetamol beforehand) which lasted for almost 3 days! I'm not sure if this was down to the cold cap or side effects of chemo, or just tension/anxiety. I'm going to see how much hair falls out around day 14 then decide whether I can bear to persevere with it. Maybe stronger painkillers next time would help? Good luck to everyone, hope the side effects are manageable and glad to have ticked the first session off xx
